article.aside: Allow for opaque HTTP message bodies: if our content type isn't application/x-www-form-urlencoded, multipart/form-data, or text/plain (during a POST only), then accept the HTTP body as a single object and validate it against the empty-key validator. Add the HTTP methods stipulated by HTTP Extensions for Web Distributed Authoring and Versioning (WebDAV) and Calendaring Extensions to WebDAV (CalDAV). Lastly, allow for the HTTP request headers to be exported to the struct kreq object as both a list and, for common HTTP headers, an indexed map.
